title: Quiz 7: Instructional Media
description: Test your knowledge of instructional media, including how to select, prepare, use, and store various teaching aids.

questions.question: Which of the following is a 'Projected' teaching aid?
questions.explanation: The OHP projects an image onto a screen. Others are non-projected.

questions.question: What are the advantages of using an Overhead Projector?

options.text: Room doesn't need to be dark
Transparencies can be prepared in advance

questions.explanation: OHP allows eye contact, works in light, and uses reusable slides. It needs power.

questions.question: When using a flipchart, you should read the text on the chart word-for-word to the audience.
questions.explanation: You should not read the chart. Write notes on the back to guide you so you can face the audience.

questions.question: The teaching aid considered the 'device of choice' for teaching villagers in rural areas is the ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Flannel boards are portable, cheap, visual, and require no electricity.

questions.question: Match the teaching aid to its correct storage method:
questions.explanation: Proper storage ensures longevity and easy retrieval.

questions.question: What is the 'Real Thing' in teaching aids?
questions.explanation: The 'Real Thing' provides the most accurate sensory experience (e.g., a baby moving and crying).

questions.question: Order the steps for using teaching aids effectively:
What is the minimum recommended letter height for OHP transparencies?
Handouts should be used as a complete substitute for textbooks.
questions.explanation: Handouts guide and supplement; they do not replace comprehensive texts.

questions.question: A disadvantage of the Chalkboard is:

options.text: It is messy (dust) and time-consuming to write

questions.explanation: Chalk dust is messy and writing takes valuable lesson time.
